soilMappingUnitIdentifier.description: Identifier to map dataset to other datasets

ID.description: Internal unique indexed database identifier (4-byte integer)

muGlobal.description: The Global Mapping Unit identifier (4-byte integer) provides the link between the GIS layer and the attribute database

muSource1.description: This alphanumerical field stores the main mapping unit identifier from the source database, as shown below

muSource2.description: This second (4-byte numerical) identifier may be used to accommodate a second unit identifier in the source database; it has been populated with the STU from ESDB only

coverage.description: This field stores the source of the record

isSoil.description: Field indicating if the soil mapping unit is a soil or a non-soil

SEQ.description: The sequence in which soil units within the soil mapping unit are presented follow the rule that the dominant soil always has sequence 1. The sequence can range between 1 and 9

share.description: Share of the soil unit within the mapping unit in %. Shares of component soil units5 of a mapping unit always sum up to 100%

soilUnitNaming.description: Features used in labeling plots of land based of soil characteristics

texture.description: Topsoil textural class refers to the simplified textural classes for 0-30cm used in the Soil Map of the World (FAO/Unesco, 1970-1980). Because of the scale of the map (1:5 million) only three simplified textural classes were used

refDepth.description: Reference depth of the soil unit

AWC.description: Available water storage capacity in mm/m of the soil unit

SUSymbol.description: This symbol stands for the spatially dominant major soil group

SUSym74.description: This is the soil unit symbol according to the FAO-74 soil classification, as used for the DSMW coverage

SUSym85.description: This is the soil unit symbol according to the FAO-85 interim soil classification which is used for the ESDB coverage

SUSym90.description: This is the soil unit symbol according to the FAO-90 soil classification, which was used here for the ESDB, China and SOTWIS coverage

SUCode74.description: The numerical code for the FAO-74 soil classification system

SUCode85.description: The numerical code for the FAO-85 soil classification system

SUCode90.description: The numerical code for the FAO-90 soil classification system

soilPhases.description: Phases are subdivisions of soil units based on characteristics which are significant for the use or management of the land but are not diagnostic for the separation of the soil units themselves

phase1.description: Phases are subdivisions of soil units based on characteristics which are significant for the use or management of the land but are not diagnostic for the separation of the soil units themselves

phase2.description: Phases are subdivisions of soil units based on characteristics which are significant for the use or management of the land but are not diagnostic for the separation of the soil units themselves

roots.description: Provides the depth class of an obstacle to roots within the STU

impermeableLayer.description: : Indicates the presence of an impermeable layer within the soil profile of the STU. The code is only available in ESDB

soilWaterRegimeSWR.description: : Indicates the dominant annual average soil water regime class of the soil profile of the STU. The code is only available in ESDB

soilProperties.description: Derived chemical and physical soil properties are provided for topsoil

addProp.description: Certain soil properties, inherent to the soil unit definition that are relevant for agricultural use

tGravel.description: Volumne percentage of gravel present in topsoil

tSand.description: Percentage of sand in the topsoil

tSlit.description: Percentage of silt in the topsoil

tClay.description: Percentage of clay in the topsoil

tUsdaTexClass.description: USDA texture class name and code for topsoil

tTeb.description: the total exchangeable bases in the topsoil

tOc.description: percentage of organic carbon in topsoil

tCecClay.description: the cation exchange capacity of the clay fraction in topsoil

tCecSoil.description: the cation exchange capacity in topsoil

tCaCO3.description: the calcium carbonate (lime) content in topsoil

tEsp.description: the exchangeable sodium percentage in the topsoil

sGravel.description: Volumne percentage of gravel present in topsoil

sSand.description: Percentage of sand in the subsoil

sSlit.description: Percentage of silt in the subsoil

sClay.description: Percentage of clay in the subsoil

sUsdaTexClass.description: USDA texture class name and code for subsoil

sTeb.description: the total exchangeable bases in the subsoil

sOc.description: percentage of organic carbon in subsoil

sCecClay.description: the cation exchange capacity of the clay fraction in subsoil

sCecSoil.description: the cation exchange capacity in subsoil

sCaCO3.description: the calcium carbonate (lime) content in subsoil

sEsp.description: the exchangeable sodium percentage in the subsoil
